item.title: Karen add a quote by Abraham Verghese
item.description: "The world turns on our every action, and our every omission, whether we know it or not." -- Abraham Verghese

item.title: Karen add a quote by Dale Carnegie
item.description: "It isn't what you have or who you are or where you are or what you are doing that makes you happy or unhappy. It is what you think about it." -- Dale Carnegie

item.title: Karen add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "Why did you do all this for me?' he asked. 'I don't deserve it. I've never done anything for you.' 'You have been my friend,' replied Charlotte. 'That in itself is a tremendous thing." -- E.B. White

item.title: Karen add a quote by Margaret Walker
item.description: "When I was about eight, I decided that the most wonderful thing, next to a human being, was a book." -- Margaret Walker

item.title: Karen add a quote by Marjorie Kinnan Rawlings
item.description: "Somewhere beyond the sink-hole, past the magnolia, under the live oaks, a boy and a yearling ran side by side, and were gone forever." -- Marjorie Kinnan Rawlings

item.title: Karen add a quote by Michael Ondaatje
item.description: "She had always wanted words, she loved them; grew up on them. Words gave her clarity, brought reason, shape." -- Michael Ondaatje

item.title: Karen add a quote by Lenore Hershey
item.description: "Do give books - religious or otherwise - for Christmas. Theyâ€™re never fattening, seldom sinful, and permanently personal." -- Lenore Hershey
